desc.emissive: Self-luminous material. Light color and intensity can be adjusted

chat.nopermission: Você não tem permissão para usar o chat

divinggoggles.desc: Part of diving equipment that allows you to see clearly underwater
divinggoggles.name: Diving mask

groucho.desc: It provides perfect disguise. No one will recognize you
groucho.name: Groucho glasses

helmet2_lamp.desc: A modern climbing helmet with a lamp attached to it
helmet2_lamp.name: Climbing helmet (lamp)

helmet_lamp.desc: A modern safety helmet with a lamp attached to it
helmet_lamp.name: Safety helmet (lamp)

mininghelmet.desc: An old miner's helmet with a candle attached to it that lights up your way in dark areas
mininghelmet.name: Miner's helmet

poster.desc: Pode ser usado para fazer upload de imagens do seu disco rígido e colocá-las no mundo
poster.name: Poster

server.copyip: Copiar IP para a área de transferência

crafting.selectcolor: Selecione a cor do elemento de construção
crafting.unlockedallrecipes: Você já conhece todas as receitas desta categoria

aluminiumplate.desc: A sheet made out of aluminum
aluminiumplate.name: Aluminum sheet

aluminiumwire.desc: A small wire, made out of aluminum
aluminiumwire.name: Aluminum wire

arrowexplosive.desc: An explosive arrow that detonates on impact. Much heavier than regular arrows
arrowexplosive.name: Explosive arrow

arrowprimitive.desc: A primitive arrow that is quite inaccurate
arrowprimitive.name: Primitive arrow

axe.desc: An iron axe. Can be used to cut down trees or to destroy wooden structures
axe.name: Axe

axesteel.desc: A modern steel axe. More efficient and robust than the iron axe
axesteel.name: Axe (steel)

bandage.desc: Can be used to stop bleeding
bandage.name: Bandage

blueprint.desc: Allows you to place a copy of a previously saved structure
blueprint.name: Blueprint

blueprintempty.desc: Use it to save your structures and buildings
blueprintempty.name: Empty blueprint

bomb.desc: Creates an explosion which only damages soft targets
bomb.name: Old grenade

bow1.desc: A simple bow with which arrows can be shot
bow1.name: Bow

branch.desc: Natural resource. Can be used to craft sticks
branch.name: Branch

breaddough.desc: Dough for a simple and tasty bread. REQUIRES BAKING
breaddough.name: Bread dough

canteen.desc: A drinking bottle. Can be filled with water
canteen.name: Canteen

circuitboard.desc: Essential component of many electric devices
circuitboard.name: Circuit board

combatknife.desc: Mainly used as weapon, but is also required for tanning
combatknife.name: Combat knife

cookiedough.desc: Dough for a tasteful cookie. REQUIRES BAKING
cookiedough.name: Cookie dough

cotton.desc: Can be spun to yarn on a spinning wheel
cotton.name: Cotton

decal.desc: Semelhante a um poster, mas adapta-se ao solo. Ideal se você deseja projetar uma imagem em uma superfície irregular
decal.name: Decalque

dynamite.desc: Creates an explosion which only causes little damage to the environment
dynamite.name: Dynamite

engineboat1.desc: An outboard engine that can be attached to certain boats
engineboat1.name: Outboard engine (20 hp)

flour.desc: Made from grinded grains. Is used to make different foods, especially dough
flour.name: Flour

goldplate.desc: A sheet made out of gold
goldplate.name: Gold sheet

goldwire.desc: A small wire, made out of gold
goldwire.name: Gold wire

gunpowder.desc: Explosive powder. Important ingredient for the production of various ammunition and explosives
gunpowder.name: Gunpowder

hempfibers.desc: Can be spun to yarn on a spinning wheel
hempfibers.name: Hemp fibers

hoe.desc: Used to prepare the ground for cultivation
hoe.name: Hoe

hoesteel.desc: Used to prepare the ground for cultivation. More robust than the iron hoe
hoesteel.name: Hoe (steel)

ironplate.desc: Basic crafting resource, made out of iron ingots
ironplate.name: Iron sheet

ironwire.desc: A small wire, made out of iron
ironwire.name: Iron wire

measuringtape.desc: Can be used to measure the distance between two points
measuringtape.name: Measuring tape

medkit.desc: Fully restores your health and stops bleeding
medkit.name: Medkit

miningdrill.desc: An electric mining drill. Highly efficient. It breaks stone in no time.
miningdrill.name: Mining drill

oldshears.desc: Used to shear sheeps to get their wool
oldshears.name: Shear

oredetector.desc: An ore detector, which can find nearby veins of ore
oredetector.name: Ore detector

paddle1.desc: Wooden paddles. Required for small rowboats
paddle1.name: Paddle (wood)

paintroller.desc: Used to paint surfaces. Works a lot faster than a paintbrush
paintroller.name: Paint roller

pickaxe.desc: An iron pickaxe. Used for mining stone and ores
pickaxe.name: Pickaxe

pickaxesteel.desc: A modern steel pickaxe. More efficient and robust than the iron pickaxe
pickaxesteel.name: Pickaxe (steel)

poster.desc: Um poster. Você pode usá-lo para carregar uma imagem do seu disco rígido e colocá-la no mundo
poster.name: Poster

pouch.desc: A pouch which may contain valuable loot
pouch.name: Pouch

primitiveaxe.desc: Primitive tool. Can be used to break rocks or cut trees, but is not very effective
primitiveaxe.name: Primitive stone axe

primitiveknife.desc: A primitive knife. Not very effective, but serves as a basic melee weapon and is also required for tanning
primitiveknife.name: Primitive stone knife

primitivespear.desc: A primitive spear with a stone head. Can both be thrown at targets and used as melee weapon
primitivespear.name: Primitive spear

rags.desc: Some rags. Can be recycled into paper.
rags.name: Rags

rake.desc: Used to smooth out the ground. More efficient and robust than the wooden rake
rake.name: Rake

rakewood.desc: Used to smooth out the ground
rakewood.name: Wooden rake

repeater.desc: A bold action repeating rifle. Superior to the musket in terms of firing rate, accuracy and effective range
repeater.name: Repeater

ribkit1.desc:
Base kit for crafting a rigid-inflatable-boat. Place it on solid ground to assemble the boat.
<color=yellow>Kit 1 of 2</color>
ribkit1.name: Inflatable boat kit I (Rigid hull)

ribkit2.desc:
Base kit for crafting a rigid-inflatable-boat. Attach it to an existing rigid hull (see kit 1).
<color=yellow>Kit 2 of 2</color>
ribkit2.name: Inflatable boat kit II (Tubes)

rowboatkit1.desc:
Base kit for crafting a rowboat. Place it anywhere on land to assemble the boat.
<color=yellow>Kit 1 of 2</color>
rowboatkit1.name: Rowboat kit I (Frame)

rowboatkit2.desc:
Base kit for crafting a rowboat. Attach it to an existing rowboat frame (see kit 1).
<color=yellow>Kit 2 of 2</color>
rowboatkit2.name: Rowboat kit II (Hull)

rowboatstorage.desc: Optional storage that can be attached to rowboats
rowboatstorage.name: Storage (Rowboat)

saplingapple.desc: A sapling of an apple tree
saplingapple.name: Sapling (apple tree)

saplingaraucaria.desc: A sapling of a big araucaria
saplingaraucaria.name: Sapling (araucaria)

saplinghickory.desc: A sapling of a hickory tree
saplinghickory.name: Sapling (hickory)

saplinglondonplane.desc: A sapling of a london plane
saplinglondonplane.name: Sapling (london plane)

saplingpalm.desc: A sapling of a palm tree
saplingpalm.name: Sapling (palm)

saplingpalm2.desc: A sapling of a palm tree, grown from a coconut
saplingpalm2.name: Sapling (palm)

saplingredmaple.desc: A sapling of a red maple tree
saplingredmaple.name: Sapling (red maple)

saplingspruceforest.desc: A sapling of a big forest spruce
saplingspruceforest.name: Sapling (forest spruce)

saplingweepingbeech.desc: A sapling of a weeping beech
saplingweepingbeech.name: Sapling (weeping beech)

saplingwillowoak.desc: A sapling of a willow oak
saplingwillowoak.name: Sapling (willow oak)

scythe.desc: Useful to clear large areas of grass
scythe.name: Scythe

scythesteel.desc: Useful to clear large areas of grass. More robust than the iron scythe
scythesteel.name: Scythe (steel)

sickle.desc: Useful if you want to collect grass or smaller plants
sickle.name: Sickle

sicklesteel.desc: Useful if you want to collect grass or smaller plants. More robust than the iron sickle
sicklesteel.name: Sickle (steel)

sledgehammer.desc: Used to remove construction elements without destroying them
sledgehammer.name: Sledge\u00ADhammer

sledgehammersteel.desc: Used to remove construction elements without destroying them. More effective and robust than the iron sledgehammer
sledgehammersteel.name: Sledge\u00ADhammer (steel)

splint.desc: An improvised leg splint. Supports the cure of a bone fracture
splint.name: Leg splint

treelogacacia.desc: Piece of log of an acacia
treelogacacia.name: Piece of log (acacia)

treelogapple.desc: Piece of log of an apple tree
treelogapple.name: Piece of log (apple tree)

treelogaraucaria.desc: Piece of log of an araucaria
treelogaraucaria.name: Piece of log (araucaria)

treelogbirch.desc: Piece of log of a birch
treelogbirch.name: Piece of log (birch)

treelogcactus.desc: Piece of log of a cactus
treelogcactus.name: Piece of log (cactus)

treelogcypress.desc: Piece of log of a cypress
treelogcypress.name: Piece of log (cypress)

treeloghickory.desc: Piece of log of a hickory tree
treeloghickory.name: Piece of log (hickory)

treeloglondonplane.desc: Piece of log of a london plane
treeloglondonplane.name: Piece of log (london plane)

treelogpalm.desc: Piece of log of a palm tree
treelogpalm.name: Piece of log (palm)

treelogredmaple.desc: Piece of log of a red maple tree
treelogredmaple.name: Piece of log (red maple)

treelogspruce.desc: Piece of log of a spruce
treelogspruce.name: Piece of log (spruce)

treelogweepingbeech.desc: Piece of log of a weeping beech
treelogweepingbeech.name: Piece of log (weeping beech)

treelogwillowoak.desc: Piece of log of a willow oak
treelogwillowoak.name: Piece of log (willow oak)

tungstenplate.desc: A sheet made out of tungsten
tungstenplate.name: Tungsten sheet

tungstenwire.desc: A small wire, made out of tungsten
tungstenwire.name: Tungsten wire

wateringcan.desc: Used to water plants by hand
wateringcan.name: Watering can

waterskin.desc: A receptacle made out of leather. Can be filled with water
waterskin.name: Waterskin

wool.desc: Obtainable from sheeps. Can be spun to yarn on a spinning wheel
wool.name: Wool

yarn.desc: Consists of fabrics, spun at a spinning wheel. Used to create various fabrics
yarn.name: Yarn

error.gamefilecorrupted:
One or more game files are corrupted! 
Please try to verify the integrity of the game cache or download the game again.

<color=orange>Corrupted file: 
{0}</color>
error.gamefilecorruptedsteam:
One or more game files are corrupted! 

Please try to verify the integrity of the game cache:
1. Rightclick on Rising World in your Steam library
2. Select "Properties"
3. Go to "Local files"
4. Select "Verify integrity of game files"


<color=orange>Corrupted file: 
{0}</color>
error.graphicsmemory:
There seems to be an error related to {0} or your graphics memory. This is either caused by insufficient VRAM, or by a graphics driver issue. If your graphics driver is up-to-date, consider lowering some graphics settings (especially regarding texture quality) to reduce the VRAM consumption.

<color=yellow>Error: {1}</color>
error.graphicswarning:
An internal {0} error occurred. Usually this happens if the graphics driver is outdated, or if the graphics card does not support a particular feature.
Please download and install the latest graphics driver from the homepage of your graphics card manufacturer. 

<color=yellow>Error: {1}</color>
error.nocomputeshaders:
Compute shaders are required, but apparently not supported by this graphics adapter: 

<color=red>{0}</color>

This may be caused by an outdated or erroneous graphics driver. Please try to download and install the latest graphics driver.
error.noinstancing:
GPU instancing is required, but not supported by this graphics adapter: 

<color=red>{0}</color>

This may be caused by an outdated or erroneous graphics driver. Please try to download and install the latest graphics driver.
error.notexturearrays:
Texture Arrays are required, but not supported by this graphics adapter: 

<color=red>{0}</color>

This may be caused by an outdated or erroneous graphics driver. Please try to download and install the latest graphics driver.
error.recordingdeviceerror:
Unable to initialize your recording device
Please try to select a different recording device in the audio settings
error.steamapi:
Could not initialize Steam API.

In most cases you can fix this issue by restarting your Steam client.
error.steamapitimeout:
Could not initialize Steam API (Timeout)

In most cases you can fix this issue by restarting your Steam client.
error.steamlibmissing:
Could not find the Steamworks library. This indicates that some game files are probably corrupted or missing, or the game can not access them.

Please try to verify the integrity of the game files: 

  1. Rightclick on Rising World in your Steam library
  2. Select Properties
  3. Go to "Local files"
  4. Select "Verify integrity of game files"
error.windows7:
Unfortunately there is a bug in the latest Unity version, which prevents the game from running on Windows 7. We have already reported this bug to Unity, and Unity did also confirm it.

Because this is a bug in the engine itself, we have no control over it unfortunately, so we have to wait until Unity fixes this issue.

We are sorry about the inconvenience! We have created a pinned topic in the Steam forums about this issue, which also contains a link to Unitys public bug tracker. We'll update the thread as soon as we have any news.

animalfeeder.desc: Can be used to attract wild animals
animalfeeder.name: Animal feeder

blueprinttable.desc: Allows you to organize and select your blueprints
blueprinttable.name: Blueprint table

bonfire.desc: Large fire which is visible from a long distance. Provides warmth, light and safety
bonfire.name: Bonfire

campfire.desc: Provides warmth, light and safety. Can also be used to cook meat
campfire.name: Campfire

campfiregrill.desc: A grill rack. Place it on a campfire to cook meat
campfiregrill.name: Cooking grate

chest1.desc: Can be used to store items
chest1.name: Old chest

chest2.desc: Can be used to store items
chest2.name: Old chest

chest3.desc: Lockable chest. Can be used to store items
chest3.name: Chest

chickencoop.desc: Used to safely house chickens, which in turn can lay eggs in it
chickencoop.name: Chicken coop

decal.desc: Semelhante a um poster, mas adapta-se ao solo. Ideal se você deseja projetar uma imagem em uma superfície irregular
decal.name: Decalque

doorglass1b.desc: A modern glass door with a thin metal frame
doorglass1b.name: Glass door (frame)

doorglass2b.desc: A modern glass door with a thin metal frame
doorglass2b.name: Glass door (frame)

floodlight.desc: Versatile floodlight with integrated battery. Provides extremely bright light
floodlight.name: Floodlight

furnace.desc: Enables you to smelt ores into ingots (24 slots)
furnace.name: Smelting furnace

furnacebig.desc: Enables you to smelt ores into ingots. Has a higher fuel consumption, but also a particularly large capacity (60 slots)
furnacebig.name: Big smelting furnace

grinder.desc: Is used for grinding solid materials
grinder.name: Grinder

grindstone.desc: A grinding stone that can be used to sharpen certain tools and weapons (like swords), which improves their stats
grindstone.name: Grindstone

ironsign1.desc: A hanging sign, made out of iron. Can display text
ironsign1.name: Hanging iron sign

jackolantern.desc: A carved pumpkin, which can be used as decoration on Halloween
jackolantern.name: Jack-o'-lantern

leathertrunk.desc: Square and small, but with plenty of storage space
leathertrunk.name: Leather trunk

masonryoven.desc: An oven made out of stone. Can be used for baking food
masonryoven.name: Masonry oven

meatdryer.desc: Used to dry raw meat. This preserves the meat, but it takes a long time
meatdryer.name: Drying rack

piano.desc: A piano which can be played using your keyboard
piano.name: Piano

placard.desc: A large sheet on which text can be applied
placard.name: Placard

poster.desc: Um poster. Você pode usá-lo para carregar uma imagem do seu disco rígido e colocá-la no mundo
poster.name: Poster

primitivefurnace.desc: Enables you to smelt ores into ingots, but has limited capacity (8 slots)
primitivefurnace.name: Primitive smelting furnace

primitiveshelter.desc: Improvised shelter. You can sleep in it and set your spawn point, but it doesn't look very stable...
primitiveshelter.name: Primitive shelter

primitiveworkbench.desc: Very simple workbench, used to craft basic tools
primitiveworkbench.name: Primitive workbench

scaffolding1.desc: A temporary, modular wooden structure to support constructing a building
scaffolding1.name: Scaffolding

scaffolding1_frame.desc: The frame of a wooden scaffolding
scaffolding1_frame.name: Scaffolding (frame)

scaffolding1_platform.desc: The upper platform of a wooden scaffolding
scaffolding1_platform.name: Scaffolding (platform)

scaffolding1_railing.desc: An optional railing that can be attached to a scaffolding
scaffolding1_railing.name: Scaffolding railing

scaffolding1_ramp.desc: A wooden scaffolding which includes a ramp
scaffolding1_ramp.name: Scaffolding (ramp)

scaffolding1_small.desc: A smaller version of the wooden scaffolding
scaffolding1_small.name: Small scaffolding

scaffolding1_small_ladder1.desc: A small wooden scaffolding with an open hatch and a ladder
scaffolding1_small_ladder1.name: Small scaffolding (ladder)

scaffolding1_small_ladder2.desc: A small wooden scaffolding with an open hatch and a ladder
scaffolding1_small_ladder2.name: Small scaffolding B (ladder)

scaffolding1_small_ladder3.desc: A small wooden scaffolding with an open hatch
scaffolding1_small_ladder3.name: Small scaffolding (open hatch)

scaffolding1_small_ladder4.desc: A small wooden scaffolding with an open hatch
scaffolding1_small_ladder4.name: Small scaffolding B (open hatch)

scaffolding1_small_railing.desc: An optional railing that can be attached to a scaffolding
scaffolding1_small_railing.name: Small scaffolding railing

scaffolding1b.desc: A temporary, modular wooden structure to support constructing a building
scaffolding1b.name: Scaffolding (B)

scaffolding1b_small.desc: A smaller version of the wooden scaffolding
scaffolding1b_small.name: Small scaffolding (B)

sign.desc: A simple wooden sign that displays text
sign.name: Sign

sign1.desc: A small wooden sign that can display text
sign1.name: Small wooden sign

sign2.desc: A wooden sign that can display text
sign2.name: Wooden sign

sign3.desc: A standing wooden sign that can display text
sign3.name: Standing sign

skewer.desc: A simple wooden skewer. Place it on a campfire to cook meat
skewer.name: Skewer

spinningwheel.desc: Is used for spinning yarn from fibers or wool
spinningwheel.name: Spinning wheel

standingtorch.desc: Provides light. Can be placed anywhere
standingtorch.name: Standing torch

tanningrack.desc: Is used to turn animal hides and pelts into leather. A knife is required for that
tanningrack.name: Tanning rack

tentmodern.desc: Two-person tent which allows you to sleep and set your spawn point
tentmodern.name: Modern tent

tentsmall.desc: One-person tent which allows you to sleep and set your spawn point
tentsmall.name: Small tent

text.desc: A transparent sign where only the text is visible
text.name: Text

trapdoor.desc: A trapdoor which can be attached to certain scaffolding
trapdoor.name: Trapdoor

trashcan1.desc: Used for the disposal of items you no longer need
trashcan1.name: Trash can

trashcan2.desc: Used for the disposal of items you no longer need
trashcan2.name: Trash can (metal)

trough.desc: A container which can be filled with water
trough.name: Trough

weathervane.desc: Used to show the current direction of the wind
weathervane.name: Weather vane

woodenbarrel.desc: Can be used to store items
woodenbarrel.name: Wooden barrel

woodenbarrelopen.desc: A container which can be filled with water
woodenbarrelopen.name: Wooden barrel (open)

workbench.desc: Standard workbench, used to craft common tools
workbench.name: Workbench

workbenchmodern.desc: Modern workbench, used to craft modern tools
workbenchmodern.name: Modern workbench

area.addplayer: Determines if the player is allowed to add a player to an area
area.canenter: [AREA PERMISSION ONLY] Determines if the player is allowed to enter this area
area.canleave: [AREA PERMISSION ONLY] Determines if the player is allowed to leave this area
area.removeplayer: Determines if the player is allowed to remove a player from an area
area.setname: Determines if the player is allowed to change the name of an area

blueprint.create: Determines whether or not a player is allowed to create new blueprints (from any buildings)
blueprint.createown: Determines whether or not a player is allowed to create new blueprints which only contain his own buildings
blueprint.maxelements: Determines the maximum number of elements a blueprint the player wants to place may contain
blueprint.maxsize: Determines the maximum size / bounds of a blueprint (width, length and height)
blueprint.place: Determines whether or not a player is allowed to place a blueprint in the world
blueprint.placelimitsession: Determines an optional limit for how many blueprints a player may place during a session. Set -1 for no limit
blueprint.placeterrain: Determines whether or not a player is allowed to place terrain via blueprints
blueprint.placevegetation: Determines whether or not a player is allowed to place vegetation (plants, trees etc) via blueprints

command.backup: Determines if the player is allowed to execute any world backup commands
command.ban: Determines if the player is allowed to ban other players
command.cleanup: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "cleanup" command
command.clearinventory: Determines if the player is allowed to clear his inventory via command
command.deletenpc: Determines if the player is allowed to execute the "deletenpc" command
command.deleteplayer: Determines if the player is allowed to execute the "deleteplayer" command
command.disablenpc: Determines if the player is allowed to disable a certain npc on this server via command
command.findbase: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "findbase" command to find the chunk which contains most construction elements
command.gc: Determines if the player is allowed to invoke the serverside garbage collector ("servergc" command)
command.getplayerinfo: Determines if the player may query player information via "playerinfo" command
command.getserverinfo: Determines if the player may query server information via "serverinfo" command
command.heal: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "heal" command
command.itemgive: Determines if the player is allowed use the "item" or "give" command to give himself (or another player) an item
command.kick: Determines if the player is allowed to kick other players from the server
command.kill: Determines if the player is allowed to kill himself via command
command.makeadmin: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "makeadmin" command to grant admin rights to a player
command.plugins: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "plugins" command to get a list of all installed plugins on the server
command.reloadjournal: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "reloadjournal" command
command.reloadpermissions: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "reloadpermissions" command
command.reloadplugins: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "reloadplugins" command
command.reloadscheduler: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "reloadscheduler" command
command.restart: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "restart" command to restart the server
command.revokeadmin: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "revokeadmin" command to revoke admin rights from a player
command.saveall: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "saveall" command to manually invoke the server to save the world
command.savepermissions: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "savepermissions" command to save the current permissions to file
command.setclothing: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "setclothing" command to set his current outfit as new default spawn outfit for all players
command.setdate: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "setdate" command to set the current ingame date on the server
command.setdefaultgroup: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "setdefaultgroup" command to set the default permission group for new players
command.setinventory: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "setinventory" command to set his current inventory as new default spawn inventory for all players
command.setplayergroup: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "spg" command to set the permission group for a player
command.setsky: Determines if the player is allowed to execute sky-related commands (like "skyrotation")
command.setspawn: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "setspawn" command to set the default server spawn
command.settime: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "settime" or "tod" command to set the current ingame time-of-day
command.settimespeed: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "settimespeed" command to set the current ingame time speed
command.setweather: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "weather" command to set the current ingame weather
command.showareas: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "showareas" command to visualize all areas
command.shutdown: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "shutdown" command to shut the server down
command.spawnnpc: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "spawnnpc" command to spawn an npc
command.spawnvehicle: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "spawnvehicle" command to spawn a vehicle
command.teleport: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "teleport" or "goto" command to teleport himself (or another player)
command.updatescheduler: Determines if the player is allowed to update the scheduler (add or remove tasks)
command.yell: Determines if the player is allowed to send announcement messages via "yell" command

creative.allrecipes: Determines if the player has access to all crafting recipes in creative mode
creative.areatools: Determines if the player is allowed to use the creative mode area tools (F9)
creative.edittools: Determines if the player is allowed to use the creative mode edit tools (F8)
creative.fly: Determines if the player is allowed to fly in creative mode
creative.freecrafting: Determines if no resources are required to craft items in creative mode
creative.godmode: Determines if the player is invulnerable in creative mode
creative.infiniteitems: If true, the player never consumes any items in creative mode
creative.instantdigging: Determines if the player can destroy terrain or objects with few strikes in creative mode
creative.light: Determines if the player is allowed to use the creative mode light (L)
creative.placementtools: Determines if the player is allowed to use the creative mode placement tools (F6)
creative.removaltools: Determines if the player is allowed to use the creative mode removal tools (F7)
creative.terraintools: Determines if the player is allowed to use the creative mode terrain tools (F5)
creative.watertools: Determines if the player is allowed to use the creative mode water tools (F5)

forbidden.items: Optional list of items the player is not allowed to craft, pick up or use

general.changeblockshape: Determines if the player is allowed to retroactively change the shape of a block in his inventory
general.changegamemode: Determines if the player is allowed to change the game mode (gm)
general.crafting: Determines if the player is allowed to craft any item
general.destroyitems: Determines if the player is allowed to destroy items (tools, weapons etc) in the world
general.destroyvehicles: Determines if the player is allowed to destroy vehicles
general.dropitems: Determines if the player is allowed to drop items
general.editownvehicles: Determines if the player is allowed to modify his own vehicles
general.editvehicles: Determines if the player is allowed to modify vehicles
general.fixedspawn: Determines if the player will always spawn at the default server spawn position
general.fly: Determines if the player is allowed to fly
general.godmode: Determines if the player is invulnerable
general.instantdigging: Determines if the player can destroy terrain or objects with few strikes
general.keepinventory: Determines if the player will keep his inventory upon death
general.noclipping: Determines if collisions are disabled for the player while flying ("no clipping")
general.nofalldamage: Determines if fall damage will be disabled for the player
general.nohungerthirst: Determines if hunger and thirst will be disabled for the player
general.nostamina: Determines if the player has unlimited stamina
general.notemperature: Determines if temperature will be disabled for the player
general.pickupitems: Determines if the player is allowed to pick up items
general.placeitems: Determines if the player is allowed to place items in the world
general.placevehicles: Determines if the player is allowed to place or assemble vehicles
general.pve: Determines if PvE is allowed for this player (i.e. whether or not he is allowed to kill npcs)
general.pvp: Determines if PvP is allowed for this player (i.e. whether or not he is allowed to kill other players)
general.unlockalldoors: Determines if the player is allowed to unlock all doors (even doors he does not own)
general.useallchests: Determines if the player is allowed to access all chests (even chests he does not own)
general.usealllights: Determines if the player is allowed to modify all lamps and lights (even lamps he does not own)
general.useallobjects: Determines if the player is allowed to interact with all objects (even objects he does not own)
general.useallvehicles: Determines if the player is allowed to use all vehicles (even vehicles he does not own)
general.voicechat: Determines if the player is allowed to use voice chat

image.delete: Determines if the player is allowed to delete any image on the server
image.deleteown: Determines if the player is allowed to delete his own images
image.maxamount: Determines the max amount of images (posters) the player is allowed to upload
image.maxresolution: Determines the max allowed resolution for uploaded custom images (posters)

info.chat: Determines whether or not the player is allowed to use the chat
info.chatcolor: Color for chat messages from this player (RGB). Format: #RRGGBB
info.chatemojis: Determines whether or not the player is allowed to use emojis in chat messages
info.chatnamecolor: Color for player name in chat (RGB). Format: #RRGGBB
info.chatnameprefix: Optional prefix for player name in chat
info.chatnamesuffix: Optional suffix for player name in chat
info.chatprefix: Optional prefix which will be shown in front of player chat messages
info.chatrichtext: Determines whether or not the player is allowed to use rich text tags in chat messages
info.group: Determines the "group name" that should be shown in the player list. Other than that, this permission has no relevance
info.groupcolor: Color for "group" name when shown in player list (RGB). Format: #RRGGBB
info.nametagalwaysvisible: Determines if player nametags should be visible through walls
info.nametagcolor: Color for nametag for this player (RGB). Format: #RRGGBB
info.nametagprefixcolor: Color for optional nametag prefix for this player (RGB). Format: #RRGGBB
info.nametagsuffixcolor: Color for optional nametag suffix for this player (RGB). Format: #RRGGBB
info.showadmintag: Determines if the [Admin] tag should be visible for this player in the player list
info.showdistance: Determines if the distance to this player should be shown in the player list
info.showinplayerlist: Determines if this player should be visible in the player list
info.shownametag: Determines whether or not the 3D nametag will be visible above the player

world.destroyconstructions: Determines if the player is allowed to destroy construction elements
world.destroyobjects: Determines if the player is allowed to destroy object elements (like furniture)
world.destroyownconstructions: Determines if the player is allowed to destroy his own construction elements
world.destroyownobjects: Determines if the player is allowed to destroy his own object elements (like furniture)
world.destroyownvegetations: Determines if the player is allowed to destroy his own plants or trees
world.destroyterrain: Determines if the player is allowed to destroy terrain
world.destroyvegetations: Determines if the player is allowed to destroy plants or trees
world.editconstructions: Determines if the player is allowed to edit construction elements
world.editobjects: Determines if the player is allowed to edit object elements (like furniture)
world.editownconstructions: Determines if the player is allowed to edit his own construction elements
world.editownobjects: Determines if the player is allowed to edit his own object elements (like furniture)
world.editownvegetations: Determines if the player is allowed to edit his own plants or trees
world.editvegetations: Determines if the player is allowed to edit plants or trees
world.placeconstructions: Determines if the player is allowed to place construction elements
world.placeobjects: Determines if the player is allowed to place object elements (like furniture)
world.placeobjectsexception: If "placeobjects" is now allowed, you can specify exceptions here (i.e. objects the player is still allowed to place)
world.placeterrain: Determines if the player is allowed to place terrain
world.placevegetations: Determines if the player is allowed to place plants or trees
world.undo: Determines if the player is allowed to use the "undo" command

areas.addplayermessage: Select the player(s) you want to add to this area
areas.removeplayermessage: Select the player(s) you want to remove from this area
areas.setnamemessage: Set a new name for this area

areas.setplayerpermissionmessage: Select the permission you want to apply to the selected player(s)
areas.setprioritymessage: Set the priority (integer) you want to set for this area. Default: 0

tooltips.lefttexturefixed: This is the texture that will be changed
tooltips.righttexture: Select the <u>new texture</u> here. Right-click to change additional options

Oh, snap... a fatal error occurred!

images.header: Selecione uma imagem que deseja enviar

general.cannotpausemp: You cannot pause the game in multiplayer

plants.footer: Double-click to select a plant / object

buildingradialmenu.collisions: Toggles collisions. If collisions are disabled, the center of the construction element is always exactly at your cursor position
buildingradialmenu.loadpreset: Load a previously stored size preset from hard drive
buildingradialmenu.moveprecision:
Changes the move step size during manual positioning.
Same as the "setp" console command
buildingradialmenu.pivotmode:
Toggles between automatic and manual pivot placement. In automatic mode, the game tries to find the most appropriate pivot the element could snap to. In manual mode, instead, you can define the active pivot manually (see controls for the "Next Pivot" and "Previous Pivot" key bindings).

By default, the automatic mode is active
buildingradialmenu.rotateprecision:
Changes the rotation step size, i.e. how many degrees you rotate the element per click.
Same as the "setp" console command
buildingradialmenu.rotationmode: Changes the rotation mode: In "World" rotation mode, the element always rotates around fixed world axes. In "Local" rotation mode, the rotation axes rotate with the element. The "Default" mode is a mixture of both modes
buildingradialmenu.savepreset: Stores the current size of the construction element on the hard drive
buildingradialmenu.scaleprecision:
Changes the scale step size, i.e. how much the element gets resizes per click.
Same as the "setl" console command
buildingradialmenu.texturescale: Changes the texture scale/tiling. If you choose 0.5, for example, the texture appears at half size etc.

constructions.context: Hold to bring up the building radial menu
constructions.grid: Enables or disables the grid. Without the grid, you can freely place the element, otherwise it automatically snaps to the grid
constructions.manual: Enables or disables manual positioning, i.e. the ability to move the element with the move keys. Keep this button pressed to rotate the element while manual positioning is active
constructions.modular: Enables or disables the modular pivot snapping, i.e. the element automatically snaps to another element
constructions.move: Rotates the element. If the <color=#D164FF>resize button</color> is pressed, this resizes the element instead along the <color=green>X</color>, <color=#5C8EFF>Y</color> and <color=red>Z</color> axis. If <color=#BFFBA5>surface edit</color> is active, this only moves or resizes the upper side of the element
constructions.plusminus:
If the <color=#FEAEAE>grid</color> is active, this changes the grid size.
Otherwise, if the <color=#D164FF>resize button</color> is pressed, use these buttons to resize the element proportionally
constructions.previousnextpivot: If <color=#D3E2D8>modular snapping</color> is active and pivot mode is set to manual (see <color=#8DF1FF>context menu</color>), this selects the previous/next pivot
constructions.primary: Hold to place multiple elements in a row
constructions.reset: Resets the rotation. If the <color=#D164FF>resize button</color> is pressed, this resets the current scale instead
constructions.resize: Hold this button to resize the element
constructions.secondary: Press to place the element at the current position
constructions.surfaceedit: Enables or disables the surface edit mode. In this mode you can move or resize the upper side of an element independently

surfaceedit.transform:
<color=red>Surface scale  {0} x {1} x {2}

hint.workbench: Você pode criar muitos itens úteis na bancada

textcontainer.warninglabel: Duas placas gráficas foram detectadas, mas o jogo atualmente usa o adaptador gráfico integrado Intel HD. Para alterar isso, você deve atribuir manualmente o adaptador gráfico secundário ao jogo

message.deleteimage: Você realmente deseja excluir esta imagem? Isso também remove todos os pôsteres que usam essa imagem.

grid.emptyposternotelabel:
Nenhuma imagem carregada ainda.

headercontainer.headerlabel: Select the NPCs you want to enable or disable

tooltips.mastersoundvolume: Overall volume for all sound effects and music
tooltips.sounddetails: Determines how detailed certain sounds should be
tooltips.voip: Allows you to talk to other players in multiplayer using your microphone
tooltips.voipvolume: Volume for voice chat (i.e. voice of other players)

tooltips.changeblockshape: Optional hotkey to change the shape of a block. This works with both equipped items and also in inventory while hovering the desired item with the cursor
tooltips.copyblock:
Adds a copy of the block in the world you're currently looking at to your inventory (if there is no such block in your inventory) and equips it.
In survival mode, the block gets only equipped if it is already in your inventory
tooltips.customcommand:
Enter a console command and assign it to a key. 
Everytime you press the key then, the console command will be executed
tooltips.itemduplicate: Optional hotkey to duplicate an item in inventory (while hovering the item with the cursor)
tooltips.itemsplit: Optional hotkey to split an item stack in inventory (while hovering the item with the cursor)
tooltips.quickselectblock:
Equip a block which is identical to the block in the world you're currently looking at.

In creative mode, this block gets added to your inventory if it doesn't exist there yet

graphics.maxlightdistance: Distância máxima de visão de luz
graphics.smaaquality: Qualidade do Anti-serrilhamento Morfológico de Subpíxeis (SMAA)

tooltips.ambientocclusion: Determina se a oclusão do ambiente deve estar ativa
tooltips.anisotropicfilter: A filtragem anisotrópica reduz o "desfoque" das texturas quando vistas em ângulos acentuados
tooltips.antialiasingmode:
Determina o modo anti-serrilhamento (para reduzir o serrilhamento). 
FXAA quase não tem impacto no desempenho, TAA e SMAA têm um pequeno impacto no desempenho
tooltips.chunkhelp: This setting is equal to {0} chunks in the Java version
tooltips.chunkhelplabel: NOTA: 1 chunk é igual a 4 chunks na versão Java ({0} é igual a {1} chunks)
tooltips.debris: Se ativado, a maioria dos elementos gera detritos físicos se forem destruídos
tooltips.debrisconstructions: Determina se a destruição de elementos de construção também deve gerar detritos
tooltips.decals: Determina se os decalques (como buracos de bala ou pegadas) devem ser visíveis
tooltips.depthoffield: Aplica um pequeno desfoque em terrenos e objetos distantes
tooltips.displaymode:
Determina o modo de exibição: 

<color=orange>{0} - o jogo é executado no modo exclusivo de tela cheia

{1} - o jogo é executado em uma janela de tela cheia sem bordas (configuração recomendada). Isso pode ser útil ao alternar para a área de trabalho

{2} - o jogo é executado em uma janela comum. O tamanho da janela depende da resolução</color>
tooltips.dithering: Habilite isso apenas para reduzir "faixas coloridas"
tooltips.dynamicwater: Determina se a água deve ser dinâmica (corrente). Se desativado, a água sempre será estática
tooltips.filmgrain: If enabled, a subtle film grain effect will be visible
tooltips.grassocclusion: A oclusão da grama impede que a grama seja visível através de objetos como móveis ou elementos de construção
tooltips.keepdistantbuildingsvisible: Se ativado, os edifícios permanecerão visíveis (depois de terem sido gerados uma vez) na distância máxima de visualização, independentemente da configuração da distância de visualização do edifício
tooltips.lodbias:
Determina por quanto tempo a versão mais detalhada de certos objetos (como plantas) deve permanecer visível (dependendo de quão longe eles estão). 
Valores mais baixos fazem com que as versões menos detalhadas (LOD) se tornem visíveis mais rapidamente
tooltips.lodfade: Se ativado, haverá um cross-fade suave ao alterar os níveis detalhe dos objetos (LOD)
tooltips.maxdebris: Determina a quantidade total de detritos no mundo. Observe que isso não se refere a partes individuais de detritos, mas sim por objeto. Mais precisamente, isso determina que pode gerar detritos no mundo ao mesmo tempo.
tooltips.maxlights: Determina o número máximo de luzes que o jogo renderiza simultaneamente
tooltips.monitor: Determina qual monitor (se mais de um monitor estiver conectado) deve ser usado
tooltips.motionblur:
Se você não gosta do Desfoque de movimento, considere desativar apenas "Movimento da câmera" - isso desativa o desfoque de movimento para o movimento da câmera, 
mas objetos em movimento rápido ainda apresentam um desfoque bonito
tooltips.motionblurcamera:
Se ativado, o desfoque de movimento também será aplicado ao movimento da câmera - caso contrário, será aplicado apenas a objetos em movimento rápido. 
Se você não gosta de desfoque de movimento, considere mantê-lo ativo, mas apenas desativando "Movimento da Câmera"
tooltips.refractions: Determina se a refração/distorção é aplicada ao vidro ou à água
tooltips.resolutionscale:
Diminuir esse valor permite renderizar o jogo em uma resolução mais baixa sem alterar a resolução real. 
Você só deve diminuir o valor se tiver problemas de desempenho
tooltips.screenspacereflections: Reflexões básicas. Isso pode refletir apenas os objetos que estão visíveis na tela. Isso é especialmente útil para reflexões menores, como poças de água
tooltips.shadowquality: Determina a qualidade geral da sombra, ou seja, a resolução dos mapas de sombra
tooltips.shadows: Determina se as luzes devem projetar sombras
tooltips.shadowsgrass: Determina se a grama deve projetar sombras
tooltips.shadowsterrain: Determina se o terreno deve projetar sombras. Recomenda-se manter esta configuração ativa
tooltips.softparticles: If enabled, particles have smooth borders when intersecting with objects
tooltips.terraindistanceblend: Se ativado, as texturas do terreno ficarão muito melhores à distância
tooltips.terrainheightblend:
Se ativado, diferentes texturas no terreno serão mescladas levando em consideração sua altura. 
Se desativado, haverá apenas uma interpolação linear básica entre as texturas
tooltips.texturequality: Determina a qualidade global da textura. Só reduza este valor se não tiver VRAM suficiente
tooltips.texturequalityconstructions: Determina a qualidade da textura de edifícios e elementos de construção. Aviso: Definir valores altos aumenta significativamente o uso de VRAM!
tooltips.texturequalityterrain: Determina a qualidade da textura do terreno. Aviso: definir valores altos aumenta o uso de VRAM
tooltips.viewdistance: Determina a distância de exibição de detalhes para grama e pedaços detalhados
tooltips.viewdistancebuildings: Determina a distância de visualização para prédios e construções
tooltips.viewdistancelod: Determina a distância total de visualização
tooltips.volumetricclouds: Se ativado, o jogo renderizará nuvens 3D volumétricas no mundo do jogo
tooltips.volumetriccloudsquality:
Determina a qualidade de renderização de nuvens volumétricas. Isso se torna mais perceptível se você estiver na altura das nuvens ou acima das nuvens - caso contrário, uma configuração média geralmente é suficiente. 

Lembre-se de que as configurações de alta qualidade têm um impacto considerável no desempenho
tooltips.volumetriclightfilter: Se ativado, um filtro de suavização será aplicado às luzes volumétricas
tooltips.volumetriclights: Determina se luzes volumétricas (como raios divinos) devem ser visíveis
tooltips.vsync:
Limita a taxa de quadros à taxa de atualização do monitor para evitar "rasgos".
Isso pode afetar o desempenho
tooltips.waterupdateinterval: Determina com que frequência o jogo deve recalcular o fluxo de água por segundo. Valores mais altos têm um impacto maior no desempenho

viewadjustment.tooltip: Abre um menu para ajustar configurações como campo de visão (FOV), brilho, contraste, etc.

tooltips.cinematicbars: Define o tamanho das barras pretas cinematográficas opcionais (na parte superior e inferior da tela)
tooltips.crosshair: Define a mira padrão para o jogo
tooltips.panini: Use isso para reduzir o alongamento em configurações de campo de visão muito grandes (ou em telas ultra largas). O valor padrão é 0

misc.creativelightintensity: Intensidade da Luz do Modo Criativo
misc.creativemodeshowtoolbar: Mostrar Barra de Ferramentas do Modo Criativo
misc.flymodemovetype: Controle de Movimento do Modo de Vôo
misc.flymodespeedcontrol: Controle de Velocidade do Modo de Vôo
misc.hudshowquickslotsduration: HUD: Duração da Apresentação da Barra do Slot Rápido
misc.radialmenushowcursor: Cursor do Mouse Visível no Menu Radial
misc.showbuildinggridonselector: Mostrar Grade no Elemento de Pré-visualização

tooltips.allowconsolecommands: Determina se os comandos do console devem ser permitidos
tooltips.allowflymode: Determina se voar ({0}) deve ser permitido no modo de sobrevivência
tooltips.alwaysshowgridonterrain: Se ativado, a grade SEMPRE ficará visível no terreno
tooltips.blueprintvisualizebounds: Se ativado, o limite da planta do projeto será visualizado ao colocar a planta
tooltips.buildingdefaultsize:
Define um tamanho padrão opcional para novos elementos de construção. Determina o tamanho ao longo dos eixos X, Y e Z, separados por espaços em branco.
<color=yellow>Exemplo: "1.0 2.0 0.1"</color>
tooltips.buildingmultiplacedirections: Número de direções simultâneas permitidas ao colocar vários elementos de construção em uma linha
tooltips.buildingresizemode:
Controla o comportamento de redimensionamento.

Legacy: Redimensionar funciona como redimensionar vigas na versão Java, ou seja, Para Cima/Para Baixo alteram a altura enquanto Para Esquerda/Para Direita alteram a largura <u>e</u> profundidade

Padrão: Os eixos X, Y e Z podem ser redimensionados independentemente
tooltips.buildingsnaprotation: Se ativado, o elemento se encaixa automaticamente nos eixos X, Y ou Z ao girá-lo
tooltips.collapsecraftingcategories: Se ativado, as categorias de seleção de textura de bloco são recolhidas por padrão
tooltips.creativelightintensity: Determina a intensidade da luz do modo criativo (L)
tooltips.falldamage: Se ativado, o jogador fica imune a dano de queda (no modo de sobrevivência)
tooltips.flymodemovetype:
Determina como o movimento funciona durante o vôo.

<color=yellow>Padrão: Voando na direção da visão</color>

<color=orange>Keep Elevation: Mantém a elevação/altitude</color>
tooltips.flymodenoclipping: Se ativado, você pode atravessar as paredes no modo de vôo
tooltips.flymodespeedcontrol:
Determina como a velocidade é ajustada no modo de vôo.

<color=yellow>Modo básico: mantenha pressionada a tecla sprint ou caminhada para voar mais rápido/mais lento</color>

<color=orange>Modo avançado: use Shift + Scroll do Mouse para alterar a velocidade</color>
tooltips.gravityobjects: Se ativado, objetos flutuantes (como móveis) quebram se não tiverem contato com paredes sólidas ou chão
tooltips.gravityplants: Se habilitado, as plantas flutuantes quebram se não tiverem contato com o solo
tooltips.hudshowselecteditem: Determine se o item atualmente equipado deve estar visível no canto superior direito do HUD
tooltips.hungerthirst: Determina se a fome e a sede devem ser desativadas no modo de sobrevivência
tooltips.instantdigging: Se ativado, tudo quebra com um único golpe no modo de sobrevivência (semelhante a como funciona a escavação no modo criativo)
tooltips.keepinventory: Se ativado, você manterá seu inventário após morrer
tooltips.oresmeltingduration: Determina o fator de duração para fundir minérios em uma fornalha. O padrão é 100%. Defina como 50% para metade da duração, 200% para o dobro do tempo, etc.
tooltips.pauseinmenu: Se ativado, o jogo pausa se o menu do jogo estiver ativo (apenas no modo de Um Jogador)
tooltips.peacefulmode: Se ativado, os inimigos não atacam mais você (a menos que você os ataque primeiro)
tooltips.plantgrowthduration:
Determina o fator de duração para o crescimento da planta. 
O padrão é 100%. Defina como 50% para metade da duração, 200% para o dobro do tempo, etc.
tooltips.radialmenuautoclose: Se habilitado, o menu radial fecha automaticamente ao soltar a tecla de interação
tooltips.radialmenushowcursor: Determina se o cursor do mouse deve estar visível em menus radiais
tooltips.screenshothooksteam: Se ativado, as capturas de tela serão encaminhadas para sua biblioteca de capturas de tela da Steam
tooltips.screenshotshowhud: Determina se o HUD deve ser visível nas capturas de tela
tooltips.showbuildinggrid: Determina se a grade deve ou não ficar visível durante a construção (somente se a grade estiver ativa)
tooltips.showbuildinggridonselector: Determina se a grade também deve ou não ser visível no elemento de pré-visualização
tooltips.showbuildinginformation: Se ativado, algumas informações sobre a ferramenta de construção (grade, rotação etc) serão exibidas no lado esquerdo da tela durante a construção
tooltips.showfps: Se ativado, os quadros por segundo atuais serão mostrados no canto inferior direito do HUD
tooltips.shownametags: Se ativado, os crachás de outros jogadores ficarão visíveis no modo multijogador (dependendo das configurações do servidor)
tooltips.skiploadingscreen: Se ativado, a tela de carregamento será ignorada (mesmo que o mundo não esteja totalmente carregado nesse estágio)
tooltips.spawnrateanimals:
Determina a taxa de geração dos animais. Valores mais altos resultam em mais animais, valores mais baixos em menos animais. O valor padrão é 100%

Nota: Isso não influencia os animais já gerados
tooltips.stamina: Se ativado, o jogador tem resistência ilimitada no modo de sobrevivência
tooltips.temperature: Se ativado, a temperatura não afeta o jogador (no modo de sobrevivência)
tooltips.timeduration: Determina quanto tempo leva um dia de jogo. Padrão: 1 hora
tooltips.weatherduration:
Determina quanto tempo dura o clima atual, ou seja, quanto tempo leva até que ele mude. 
O padrão é 100%. Defina para 50% para o dobro de mudanças climáticas, 200% para metade das mudanças, etc.

tooltips.openforlan: Inicia um servidor LAN. Amigos podem entrar no seu jogo através do seu endereço IP
tooltips.playwithfriends: Inicia uma sessão multijogador P2P. Amigos podem entrar no seu jogo através da lista de amigos

crafting.colorpicker:
Click to change the default color

<color=yellow>Right click to reset the color</color>
crafting.totalcount: Total amount of items you will get

rib.desc: An engine-powered, inflatable boat. Has room for 4 passengers
rib.name: Inflatable boat (RIB)

rowboat.desc: A small rowboat. Has room for a single passenger only
rowboat.name: Rowboat
